Hpr0OJ7cKZR-ohSncK292w.text: Get the dry MeeSua.It's really really delicious, cheap (4 SGD), and the service is lighting fast. Used to eat this a few nights a week while living down the street. There are some other decent looking options on either side of the MeeSua stall in case you want to mix it up.

3EbvukU3s3IacqbGvb3tZA.text: fishball is good, but don't like sweaty sauce. You can try but don't suggest for northern Chinese

Pzu-lrUjQEtsmDPOKWdAUQ.text: Where the locals go to eat. Busy at lunch during the work week. Fast and friendly food stalls.

oNjUdse68wjO33cfCZlcEg.text: Everybody is here for the MeeSua. Yes it is pretty good. I have returned here many times for the MeeSua.So today I had the Chicken Nasi Briyani. The curry chicken taste good, just as the nasi briyani rice. Price is on the steep side of $6.50. Unairconditioned. AL fresco prices probably.

photos.caption: Photo of BK Eating House - Singapore, Singapore. Big bowl $5
Photo of BK Eating House - Singapore, Singapore. Mee Sua Stall

_VDz5Q7u3qOWb1UP_8kCJg.text: Much like everyone else, I come here for the dry specialty meesua.The noodles are coated with this oil, chili and vinegar dressing, then topped with minced pork, sliced pork, ikan bilis and fresh lettuce. Served with a bowl of simple broth.It's delicious and open 24/7 except Sunday, which means its perfect for a late supper after drinks. There isn't much else to say except that you HAVE to try this dish. A true delicacy at only $4/bowl.

VE1Qs9FCO5e7YA4x_DLH6g.text: BK eating house saved my tummy more then once while I was in SG.It was located right across from where I was staying.Because of the late night hours... I was able to come here in the middle of the night and fill up on cheap eats. Everything from kaya toast and teh, noodles and rice dishes and lime juice. This place is popular with the locals and I can see why.Thank you BKEH for my numerous meals here!

photos.caption: Photo of BK Eating House - Singapore, Singapore. Kaya toast and teh at 330am!!
Photo of BK Eating House - Singapore, Singapore. Late night cheap eats!
Photo of BK Eating House - Singapore, Singapore. Noodles!!!

7yNvSA0ULDEzvL6egMSpBA.text: Extremely cheap place to eat. I was surprised by how cheap the food was and the amount of food they gave me. You could probably buy one of everything and still have money left over! Can't really comment on the sanitary conditions but seemed safe enough to eat. Feel free to sit with some random strangers. They won't mind.

Gxi-hYtdPgNuXyKCqbKunA.text: Yes. Mee sua. Yes. Mmm. We always went here after a night out and were never disappointed. I get mine without cockles and easy on the vinegar. My friends always ordered extra noodles and meat. We haven't tried the other stalls and we never really needed to. The mee sua is a beast.

WN3okABys_sTTlHh6JLXVQ.text: I absolutely love the mee sua here. I haven't tried anything else but it deserves four stars on the strength of the mee sua alone. The noodles are brilliant, the sauce is spicy, the fishballs are standard and the pork is delicious. Eat the mee sua, you won't regret it.
